> If you want to help test it simply run it, put through a scenario 
file, then
> put the resulting text file back through and see if it still runs in
> gladiator :)
> You can even try putting the scenario file back through again.

Actually, I plan on trying to copy-and-paste to add more objects to a 
scenario and use it to change level numbers.  All I would have to do 
is use a search-and-replace feature with any text editor to change 
level numbers faster as long as watched which objects I was changing.

> WARNING: Converting WILL overwrite any other file of the same name, 
the way
> it works is this:
> It takes the file you gave it as input, strips off the extension, 
and
> appends the extension of what your converting to.
> So .txt -> .fss and .fss -> .txt

Exactly why I plan on copying the next file to a new name, modifying 
it, and running it back through the converter.

> On that note, if you do find a bug, make a note of any error boxes 
that pop
> up, any exceptions that occur (one tends to follow the other...) or, 
if it's
> an error in how a file is written out, a short description of what 
is wrong.
> Then send that, along with the file you were trying to convert to me 
and
> I'll find and fix the bug :)

At last I can solve the age-old question of highest possible level 
number of gold pretty easily.
